p: The interplays between within-host infection and between hosts transmission led to arising attempts connecting the two levels [ 4, 17, 18, 24â€“ 28], but the approach is still at its infancy [ 16]. On one hand, most of these models were conceptual and theoretical [ 16, 28] or relied on assumptive and previously obtained parameter estimates [ 10, 11, 29]. We propose that this limitation can be overcomed by using explicitly within-host infection model as a unit in epidemic simulations. This allows not only a high level of heterogeneity to be expressed, but also the study of stochasticity effects in epidemic spreading.
